Esophageal obstruction after ingestion of a fiber-containing diet pill.
 Foreign bodies of the esophagus in adults may be the result of a food bolus that becomes lodged proximal to a structural abnormality of the distal esophagus.
 A case of peptic stricture of the esophagus in a patient who presented with acute dysphagia after ingesting an over-the-counter diet pill composed of guar gum is discussed.
 It is recommended that anorectics composed of dietary fiber should not be used in patients with a history of esophageal stricture.
